description.narrative: During the recent years the bilateral cooperation between Sweden and the Republic of Moldova on nuclear safety and security has successively expanded, focusing on activities to strengthening the institutional capacity of the National Agency for Regulation of Nuclear and Radiological Activities in Moldova (NARNRA). A National Strategy for Radioactive Waste Management and an Action Plan for 2017-2026 was elaborated and agreed with the Government of Moldova. One important goal of SSM’s support project is to increase the capacity of NARNRA and the Radioactive Waste Management Company`s Special Facilities 5101 and 5102 regarding infrastructure development in radioactive waste management, waste handling and treatment. As part of this project the Radioactive Waste Management Company has developed a site descriptive model for the near-surface Radon-type disposal facility and its surroundings that will serve as a basis for developing a radiological safety assessment. The site descriptive model will comprise a compilation and interpretation of existing geoscientific and meteorological data, waste properties and inventory of the disposal facility as well as data from new geoscientific and radiological measurements. The radiological safety assessment of the disposal facility will continue in 2018. The assessment will address potential future radiological consequences of the disposal facility, i.e. the consequences of migration of various radionuclides for staff, population and the environment, for the case where the disposal facility will remain as before (the zero Alternative scenario). The safety assessment will also provide a basis for developing an on-site and off-site monitoring program and support the planning of possible future decommissioning of the disposal facility. SSM has also started a project on development of the legal and regulatory framework related to radioactive waste management by providing expert advice to NARNRA, review regulatory documents and facilitate national meetings and workshops related to issues of radioactive waste management in Moldova.
